author: nc1234
content: Noob question, why do we need 0x03 at all? 0x03 builder in the spec right now is just a validator, with the same staking requirement and same duty as regular validator. Why don't we allow non-0x03s to submit bids and build payloads too? Technically any non-0x03 can become 0x03 just subject to churn limit while waiting in the queue.

author: nc1234
content: Or the other way around, 0x03 without submitting bids is identical to 0x02

author: potuz
content: It's to protect staking pools. Node operators not necessarily control the withdrawal credentials

author: potuz
content: So if they were allowed to build for others they could just simply steal the principal
